page.title: 17GREAT MEOLS:LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: On{October 11,1880,}a small brick building, with slate roof, opened as a church school.In 1980 the building still served the community as the annexe to the more recently built state school.Originally consisting of a single schoolroom with an infants' class attached,the building was heated by coal fires,occasionally causing classes to fill with smoke! Many pupils came from farming families and absented themselves at harvest time or were unable to attend because of flooding of local lanes. Emphasis was placed on the"Three Rs" (Payment by Results) as well as needle work and art. {Evacuees}swelled the school's numbers during 1939;children carrying gas mask cases to school and lessons being interrupted by air- raid warnings as dockland Birkenhead was attacked.
